lead_paragraph: In colonial America there used to be a saying: Watch for Indian attacks when the leaves come out. In 1941 Britain there is a saying: Watch for German invasion when Spring comes. Last week invasion talk mounted, and Adolf Hitler, speaking on the eighth anniversary of his chancellorship, warned that the hour to strike was close at hand.
